intro: Glaucium corniculatum var. sublobatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes罂粟 and other related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas with mild climates.
